result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy D. Slewitzke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy D. Slewitzke in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases called - 16CM138, 15CM188,16CM153, 16CM37 - Plea guilty to count 1 in 16CM138 - Plea guilty to count 1 in 16CM153 - Balance of counts DRI - 15CM188 & 16CM37 DRI - Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court -  Arguments by Bayne-Allison/Laufenberg/Court to sentencing - Count 1 in each case - 45 days jail with huber concurrent - 9 days sentence credit - To begin on or before 9:00am 3/17/17 - CC/SC - Post conviction rights given

Final pre-trial on January 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on January 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on October 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on October 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference on April 7, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy D. Slewitzke not in court.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Due to circumstances defendant could not be brought over - Transportation issues for bringing to court - This matter will be rescheduled with Mr. Laufenberg -  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages or go on tavern/bar premises  Report to the LIncoln County Jail for booking if not already completed.

Defendant, Jeremy D. Slewitzke appeared.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint read to the deft.  Attorney rights advised  Not guilty plea entered Bond set  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:50 am.
